scene_description: old book pages, ink splotches, quill pen

segment_text: He was, I take it, the most perfect reasoning and observing machine that the world has seen, but as a lover he would have placed himself in a false position.

segment_text: They were admirable things for the observer—excellent for drawing the veil from men’s motives and actions.

segment_text: But for the trained reasoner to admit such intrusions into his own delicate and finely adjusted temperament was to introduce a distracting factor which might throw a doubt upon all his mental results.
scene_description: old book pages, ink splotches, quill pen

segment_text: Grit in a sensitive instrument, or a crack in one of his own high-power lenses, would not be more disturbing than a strong emotion in a nature such as his.
scene_description: old book pages, ink splotches, quill pen

segment_text: And yet there was but one woman to him, and that woman was the late Irene Adler, of dubious and questionable memory.

segment_text: I had seen little of Holmes lately. My marriage had drifted us away from each other.
scene_description: old book pages, ink splotches, quill pen

segment_text: My own complete happiness, and the home-centred interests which rise up around the man who first finds himself master of his own establishment, were sufficient to absorb all my attention, while Holmes, who loathed every form of society with his whole Bohemian soul, remained in our lodgings in Baker Street, buried among his old books, and alternating from week to week between cocaine and ambition, the drowsiness of the drug, and the fierce energy of his own keen nature.
scene_description: old book pages, ink splotches, quill pen

segment_text: He was still, as ever, deeply attracted by the study of crime, and occupied his immense faculties and extraordinary powers of observation in following out those clues, and clearing up those mysteries which had been abandoned as hopeless by the official police.
scene_description: old book pages, ink splotches, quill pen

segment_text: From time to time I heard some vague account of his doings: of his summons to Odessa in the case of the Trepoff murder, of his clearing up of the singular tragedy of the Atkinson brothers at Trincomalee, and finally of the mission which he had accomplished so delicately and successfully for the reigning family of Holland.
scene_description: old book pages, ink splotches, quill pen

segment_text: Beyond these signs of his activity, however, which I merely shared with all the readers of the daily press, I knew little of my former friend and companion.

segment_text: One night—it was on the twentieth of March, 1888—I was returning from a journey to a patient (for I had now returned to civil practice), when my way led me through Baker Street.

segment_text: As I passed the well-remembered door, which must always be associated in my mind with my wooing, and with the dark incidents of the Study in Scarlet, I was seized with a keen desire to see Holmes again, and to know how he was employing his extraordinary powers.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian street, gas-lit window, cobblestones

segment_text: His rooms were brilliantly lit, and, even as I looked up, I saw his tall, spare figure pass twice in a dark silhouette against the blind.

segment_text: “It is simplicity itself,” said he; “my eyes tell me that on the inside of your left shoe, just where the firelight strikes it, the leather is scored by six almost parallel cuts.

scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: And yet I believe that my eyes are as good as yours.”

scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: I was already deeply interested in his inquiry, for, though it was surrounded by none of the grim and strange features which were associated with the two crimes which I have already recorded, still, the nature of the case and the exalted station of his client gave it a character of its own.

segment_text: Indeed, apart from the nature of the investigation which my friend had on hand, there was something in his masterly grasp of a situation, and his keen, incisive reasoning, which made it a pleasure to me to study his system of work, and to follow the quick, subtle methods by which he disentangled the most inextricable mysteries.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “And what of Irene Adler?” I asked.

segment_text: She lives quietly, sings at concerts, drives out at five every day, and returns at seven sharp for dinner. Seldom goes out at other times, except when she sings.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: It was a smart little landau which rattled up to the door of Briony Lodge.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: As it pulled up, one of the loafing men at the corner dashed forward to open the door in the hope of earning a copper, but was elbowed away by another loafer, who had rushed up with the same intention.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: A fierce quarrel broke out, which was increased by the two guardsmen, who took sides with one of the loungers, and by the scissors-grinder, who was equally hot upon the other side.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: A blow was struck, and in an instant the lady, who had stepped from her carriage, was the centre of a little knot of flushed and struggling men, who struck savagely at each other with their fists and sticks.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: Holmes dashed into the crowd to protect the lady; but, just as he reached her, he gave a cry and dropped to the ground, with the blood running freely down his face.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: At his fall the guardsmen took to their heels in one direction and the loungers in the other, while a number of better dressed people, who had watched the scuffle without taking part in it, crowded in to help the lady and to attend to the injured man.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: Irene Adler, as I will still call her, had hurried up the steps; but she stood at the top with her superb figure outlined against the lights of the hall, looking back into the street.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: “Is the poor gentleman much hurt?” she asked.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: “He is dead,” cried several voices.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: “No, no, there’s life in him!” shouted another. “But he’ll be gone before you can get him to hospital.”
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: “He’s a brave fellow,” said a woman. “They would have had the lady’s purse and watch if it hadn’t been for him.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: They were a gang, and a rough one, too. Ah, he’s breathing now.”
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: “He can’t lie in the street. May we bring him in, marm?”
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: “Surely. Bring him into the sitting-room. There is a comfortable sofa.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: This way, please!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: Slowly and solemnly he was borne into Briony Lodge and laid out in the principal room, while I still observed the proceedings from my post by the window.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: The lamps had been lit, but the blinds had not been drawn, so that I could see Holmes as he lay upon the couch.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: I do not know whether he was seized with compunction at that moment for the part he was playing, but I know that I never felt more heartily ashamed of myself in my life than when I saw the beautiful creature against whom I was conspiring, or the grace and kindliness with which she waited upon the injured man.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: And yet it would be the blackest treachery to Holmes to draw back now from the part which he had intrusted to me.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: I hardened my heart, and took the smoke-rocket from under my ulster. After all, I thought, we are not injuring her.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: We are but preventing her from injuring another.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: Holmes had sat up upon the couch, and I saw him motion like a man who is in need of air.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: A maid rushed across and threw open the window. At the same instant I saw him raise his hand and at the signal I tossed my rocket into the room with a cry of “Fire!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: The word was no sooner out of my mouth than the whole crowd of spectators, well dressed and ill—gentlemen, ostlers, and servant maids—joined in a general shriek of “Fire!”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: Thick clouds of smoke curled through the room and out at the open window.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: I caught a glimpse of rushing figures, and a moment later the voice of Holmes from within assuring them that it was a false alarm.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, comfortable sofa, lit lamps, open window

segment_text: Slipping through the shouting crowd I made my way to the corner of the street, and in ten minutes was rejoiced to find my friend’s arm in mine, and to get away from the scene of uproar.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban street, dusk, gas lamps lighting, residential houses

segment_text: He walked swiftly and in silence for some few minutes until we had turned down one of the quiet streets which lead towards the Edgeware Road.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “You did it very nicely, Doctor,” he remarked. “Nothing could have been better.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: It is all right.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “You have the photograph?”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “I know where it is.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “And how did you find out?”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “She showed me, as I told you she would.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “I am still in the dark.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “I do not wish to make a mystery,” said he, laughing. “The matter was perfectly simple.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: You, of course, saw that everyone in the street was an accomplice. They were all engaged for the evening.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “I guessed as much.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “Then, when the row broke out, I had a little moist red paint in the palm of my hand. I rushed forward, fell down, clapped my hand to my face, and became a piteous spectacle.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: It is an old trick.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “That also I could fathom.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “Then they carried me in. She was bound to have me in. What else could she do?
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: And into her sitting-room, which was the very room which I suspected. It lay between that and her bedroom, and I was determined to see which.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: They laid me on a couch, I motioned for air, they were compelled to open the window, and you had your chance.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “How did that help you?”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “It was all-important. When a woman thinks that her house is on fire, her instinct is at once to rush to the thing which she values most.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: It is a perfectly overpowering impulse, and I have more than once taken advantage of it. In the case of the Darlington Substitution Scandal it was of use to me, and also in the Arnsworth Castle business.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: A married woman grabs at her baby; an unmarried one reaches for her jewel-box. Now it was clear to me that our lady of to-day had nothing in the house more precious to her than what we are in quest of.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: She would rush to secure it. The alarm of fire was admirably done.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: The smoke and shouting were enough to shake nerves of steel. She responded beautifully.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: The photograph is in a recess behind a sliding panel just above the right bell-pull. She was there in an instant, and I caught a glimpse of it as she half drew it out.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: When I cried out that it was a false alarm, she replaced it, glanced at the rocket, rushed from the room, and I have not seen her since.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: I rose, and, making my excuses, escaped from the house. I hesitated whether to attempt to secure the photograph at once; but the coachman had come in, and as he was watching me narrowly, it seemed safer to wait.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: A little over-precipitance may ruin all.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “And now?” I asked.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “Our quest is practically finished. I shall call with the King to-morrow, and with you, if you care to come with us.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: We will be shown into the sitting-room to wait for the lady, but it is probable that when she comes she may find neither us nor the photograph. It might be a satisfaction to his Majesty to regain it with his own hands.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “And when will you call?”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: “At eight in the morning. She will not be up, so that we shall have a clear field.
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: Besides, we must be prompt, for this marriage may mean a complete change in her life and habits. I must wire to the King without delay.”
scene_description: outdoors, quiet London street, nighttime, dimly lit, cobblestones

segment_text: We had reached Baker Street and had stopped at the door.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian street, gas-lit window, cobblestones

segment_text: He was searching his pockets for the key when someone passing said: “Good-night, Mister Sherlock Holmes.”
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian street, gas-lit window, cobblestones

segment_text: There were several people on the pavement at the time, but the greeting appeared to come from a slim youth in an ulster who had hurried by.
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian street, gas-lit window, cobblestones

segment_text: “I’ve heard that voice before,” said Holmes, staring down the dimly lit street. “Now, I wonder who the deuce that could have been.”
scene_description: nighttime, Victorian street, gas-lit window, cobblestones

segment_text: I slept at Baker Street that night, and we were engaged upon our toast and coffee in the morning when the King of Bohemia rushed into the room.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “You have really got it!” he cried, grasping Sherlock Holmes by either shoulder and looking eagerly into his face.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “Not yet.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “But you have hopes?”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “I have hopes.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “Then, come. I am all impatience to be gone.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “We must have a cab.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “No, my brougham is waiting.”
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: “Then that will simplify matters.” We descended and started off once more for Briony Lodge.
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “Irene Adler is married,” remarked Holmes.
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “Married! When?”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “Yesterday.”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “But to whom?”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “To an English lawyer named Norton.”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “But she could not love him.”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “I am in hopes that she does.”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “And why in hopes?”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “Because it would spare your Majesty all fear of future annoyance. If the lady loves her husband, she does not love your Majesty.
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: If she does not love your Majesty, there is no reason why she should interfere with your Majesty’s plan.”
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: “It is true. And yet—! Well! I wish she had been of my own station!
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: What a queen she would have made!” He relapsed into a moody silence, which was not broken until we drew up in Serpentine Avenue.
scene_description: outdoors, cobblestone street, building facades, daytime, carriage wheel ruts

segment_text: The door of Briony Lodge was open, and an elderly woman stood upon the steps.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: She watched us with a sardonic eye as we stepped from the brougham.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: “Mr. Sherlock Holmes, I believe?” said she.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: “I am Mr. Holmes,” answered my companion, looking at her with a questioning and rather startled gaze.
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: “Indeed! My mistress told me that you were likely to call. She left this morning with her husband by the 5:15 train from Charing Cross for the Continent.”
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: “What!” Sherlock Holmes staggered back, white with chagrin and surprise. “Do you mean that she has left England?”
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: “Never to return.”
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: “And the papers?” asked the King hoarsely. “All is lost.”
scene_description: outdoors, suburban villa exterior, morning light, open doorway, steps

segment_text: “We shall see.” He pushed past the servant and rushed into the drawing-room, followed by the King and myself.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: The furniture was scattered about in every direction, with dismantled shelves and open drawers, as if the lady had hurriedly ransacked them before her flight.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: Holmes rushed at the bell-pull, tore back a small sliding shutter, and, plunging in his hand, pulled out a photograph and a letter.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: The photograph was of Irene Adler herself in evening dress, the letter was superscribed to “Sherlock Holmes, Esq. To be left till called for.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: My friend tore it open, and we all three read it together. It was dated at midnight of the preceding night and ran in this way:
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “MY DEAR MR. SHERLOCK HOLMES,—You really did it very well. You took me in completely.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: Until after the alarm of fire, I had not a suspicion. But then, when I found how I had betrayed myself, I began to think.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: I had been warned against you months ago. I had been told that, if the King employed an agent, it would certainly be you.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: And your address had been given me. Yet, with all this, you made me reveal what you wanted to know.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: Even after I became suspicious, I found it hard to think evil of such a dear, kind old clergyman. But, you know, I have been trained as an actress myself.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: Male costume is nothing new to me. I often take advantage of the freedom which it gives.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: I sent John, the coachman, to watch you, ran upstairs, got into my walking clothes, as I call them, and came down just as you departed.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “Well, I followed you to your door, and so made sure that I was really an object of interest to the celebrated Mr. Sherlock Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: Then I, rather imprudently, wished you good-night, and started for the Temple to see my husband.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “We both thought the best resource was flight, when pursued by so formidable an antagonist; so you will find the nest empty when you call to-morrow.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: As to the photograph, your client may rest in peace. I love and am loved by a better man than he.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: The King may do what he will without hindrance from one whom he has cruelly wronged. I keep it only to safeguard myself, and to preserve a weapon which will always secure me from any steps which he might take in the future.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: I leave a photograph which he might care to possess; and I remain, dear Mr. Sherlock Holmes, “Very truly yours, “IRENE NORTON, _née_ ADLER.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “What a woman—oh, what a woman!” cried the King of Bohemia, when we had all three read this epistle. “Did I not tell you how quick and resolute she was?
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: Would she not have made an admirable queen? Is it not a pity that she was not on my level?”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “From what I have seen of the lady, she seems, indeed, to be on a very different level to your Majesty,” said Holmes coldly.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “I am sorry that I have not been able to bring your Majesty’s business to a more successful conclusion.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “On the contrary, my dear sir,” cried the King; “nothing could be more successful. I know that her word is inviolate.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: The photograph is now as safe as if it were in the fire.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “I am glad to hear your Majesty say so.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “I am immensely indebted to you. Pray tell me in what way I can reward you.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: This ring—” He slipped an emerald snake ring from his finger and held it out upon the palm of his hand.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “Your Majesty has something which I should value even more highly,” said Holmes.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “You have but to name it.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “This photograph!”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: The King stared at him in amazement.
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “Irene’s photograph!” he cried. “Certainly, if you wish it.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: “I thank your Majesty. Then there is no more to be done in the matter. I have the honour to wish you a very good morning.”
scene_description: indoors, drawing-room, scattered furniture, open drawers, dismantled shelves

segment_text: He bowed, and, turning away without observing the hand which the King had stretched out to him, he set off in my company for his chambers.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: And that was how a great scandal threatened to affect the kingdom of Bohemia, and how the best plans of Mr. Sherlock Holmes were beaten by a woman’s wit.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: He used to make merry over the cleverness of women, but I have not heard him do it of late.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves

segment_text: And when he speaks of Irene Adler, or when he refers to her photograph, it is always under the honourable title of _the_ woman.
scene_description: indoors, Victorian sitting room, fireplace, cluttered bookshelves
